senses.sense_definition: To breathe quickly or in a labored manner, often due to physical exertion, heat, or excitement.

examples.text: The dog began to <w>pant</w> heavily after chasing the ball in the park.
She had to stop and <w>pant</w> for breath before climbing the next hill.

senses.sense_definition: To feel a strong, eager desire or longing for something.

examples.text: The weary travelers <w>pant</w> for the safety and comfort of their home.
His spirit seemed to <w>pant</w> after knowledge and truth.

senses.sense_definition: Of the heart, to beat with unnatural violence or rapidity.

examples.text: She felt her heart <w>pant</w> with fear as she walked through the dark forest.
His heart began to <w>pant</w> and race at the sudden shock.

senses.sense_definition: A garment covering the body from the waist downwards; a pair of trousers or underpants.

examples.text: He accidentally tore his <w>pant</w> leg on the sharp fence.
The fashion designer introduced a new wide-leg <w>pant</w> for the summer season.

traits.comment: Usually used in the plural 'pants'; the singular is often attributive or used in the fashion industry.

senses.sense_definition: A short, quick breath or gasp.

examples.text: With a loud <w>pant</w>, the runner crossed the finish line and collapsed.
Every <w>pant</w> was a struggle as they climbed higher into the thin air.
The villagers used to gather around the stone <w>pant</w> to collect water.
An old iron <w>pant</w> still stands in the center of the market square.

traits.comment: Used in parts of England, particularly the North East.

senses.sense_definition: A place name referring to various locations (rivers, villages, or localities) in the United Kingdom.

examples.text: They visited the village of <w>Pant</w> near the Welsh border.
The River <w>Pant</w> flows through the countryside of Essex.
